alert.note: Alert for Bell; Coryell; Falls; Limestone; McLennan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern McLennan, east central Coryell, northeastern Bell, southwestern Limestone and Falls Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 612 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mart to near McGregor. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waco, Temple, Hewitt, Robinson, Woodway, Marlin, McGregor, Mart, Beverly Hills, Lorena, Troy, Bruceville-Eddy, Rosebud, Moody, Riesel, Lott, Crawford, Golinda, Hallsburg and Mother Neff State Park. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 304 and 333. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
